summary:
Working as a freelance investigative journalist. I write mainly about social issues (asylum seekers, human trafficking, youth crime and women's soccer). 

I wrote for Lost in Europe, Omroep West, Argos, Magazine ZemZem and WOMEN Inc. among others.

I am particularly interested in (investigative) journalistic work, editorial work or research for documentaries, for example. You can always send me a message or email me at monica-lam@outlook.com!

The plight of unaccompanied child migrants is one of the most pressing issues in the migrant crisis. The goal of Lost in Europe is to recover the stories of these missing children. It comprises a team of investigative journalists from the Netherlands, Belgium, Italy, Germany, France, Greece and the UK, who are collaborating to find out what has happened to the disappeared children in Europe. 

The findings of Lost in Europe are published on Small Stream Media, Argos, the Guardian, Observer, BBC News, Knack, Lettera43 and Il Fatto Quotidiano.

The Foundation implements this mission through three channels: 
- Scholarships: 
- Dialogue platform: T
- Cooperation: 

Main activities: 
- Managing the programme activities of the Foundation 
- Assessing, coordinating and monitoring project proposals and travel grant applications from external relations and individuals 
- Organizing 5 informal dialogue events, a film screening and Webinar series 
- Organizing the 40th-year Anniversary Lecture at Leiden University titled 'Palestine: The Strategic Challenges of the Future and the Role of Europe' with an outcome of 250 visitors 
- Establishing new partnerships and keeping in touch with current partners 
- Writing work proposals and activity reports for the Team and Board of Directors 
- Reporting to the Director

The EMN also serves to provide the wider public with such information. 

Activities:
- Co-author EMN Thematic Study: "Beneficiaries of international protection travelling to their country of origin: Challenges, Policies and Practices in the EU Member States, Norway and Switzerland" 
- Answering Ad Hoc queries of other EU Member States on behalf of The Netherlands Point of Contact
